Gisborne’s Mātai Research Institute pioneering brain injury detectionhttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/14/gisbornes-matai-research-institute-pioneering-brain-injury-detection/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/14/gisbornes-matai-research-institute-pioneering-brain-injury-detection/ Kim ParkinsonA new MRI method has revealed a medical condition is not as rare as first thought. Mon, 13 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 (A) Standard clinical MRI image of a brain in a patient with Grinker's, where no abnormality is visible. (B) Normal brain dSIR image, for comparison. In this image, normal white matter in the central region of the image appears black (white arrows). (C) The dSIR image in the patient shows the white matter as white rather than the normal black appearance as shown in B. The white matter in the patient is highly abnormal (C).
